Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Asynchronous LDAP client for Gumdrop's non-blocking I/O framework.

This package provides a fully asynchronous LDAP client that integrates with Gumdrop's event-driven architecture. All operations use callbacks rather than blocking, making it suitable for high-concurrency scenarios.

Stateful Handler Pattern

The LDAP client uses a stateful handler pattern where interfaces guide the handler through valid operation sequences:

  • LDAPConnectionReady - Entry point, receives connection ready notification
  • LDAPConnected - Initial state, allows bind and STARTTLS
  • LDAPPostTLS - After STARTTLS, must bind before operations
  • LDAPSession - After bind, full directory operations available

This pattern provides compile-time enforcement of valid operation sequences, preventing common mistakes like searching before binding.

Result Handler Interfaces

Each operation has a corresponding result handler interface:

  • BindResultHandler - Bind results
  • StartTLSResultHandler - STARTTLS results
  • SearchResultHandler - Search entries and completion
  • ModifyResultHandler - Modify results
  • AddResultHandler - Add results
  • DeleteResultHandler - Delete results
  • CompareResultHandler - Compare results
  • ModifyDNResultHandler - Rename/move results
  • ExtendedResultHandler - Extended operation results

Usage Example


 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient(selectorLoop, "ldap.example.com", 389);

 client.connect(new LDAPConnectionReady() {
     public void handleReady(LDAPConnected connection) {
         connection.bind("cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com", "secret",
             new BindResultHandler() {
                 public void handleBindSuccess(LDAPSession session) {
                     // Now we can search
                     SearchRequest search = new SearchRequest();
                     search.setBaseDN("dc=example,dc=com");
                     search.setScope(SearchScope.SUBTREE);
                     search.setFilter("(uid=jdoe)");
                     
                     session.search(search, new SearchResultHandler() {
                         public void handleEntry(SearchResultEntry entry) {
                             System.out.println("Found: " + entry.getDN());
                         }
                         public void handleReference(String[] urls) {
                             // Handle referrals if needed
                         }
                         public void handleDone(LDAPResult result, LDAPSession session) {
                             session.unbind();
                         }
                     });
                 }
                 
                 public void handleBindFailure(LDAPResult result, LDAPConnected conn) {
                     System.err.println("Bind failed: " + result.getDiagnosticMessage());
                     conn.unbind();
                 }
             });
     }
     
     public void onConnected() { }
     public void onDisconnected() { }
     public void onTLSStarted() { }
     public void onError(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
 });

STARTTLS Example


 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient(selectorLoop, "ldap.example.com", 389);
 client.setSSLContext(sslContext);  // Configure TLS (not setSecure)

 client.connect(new LDAPConnectionReady() {
     public void handleReady(LDAPConnected connection) {
         // Upgrade to TLS before binding
         connection.startTLS(new StartTLSResultHandler() {
             public void handleTLSEstablished(LDAPPostTLS postTLS) {
                 // Now secure, proceed with bind
                 postTLS.bind("cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com", "secret",
                     new MyBindHandler());
             }
             
             public void handleStartTLSFailure(LDAPResult result, LDAPConnected conn) {
                 // TLS failed - decide whether to continue insecure
                 conn.unbind();
             }
         });
     }
     // ... other callbacks
 });

LDAPS (Implicit TLS)


 LDAPClient client = new LDAPClient(selectorLoop, "ldap.example.com", 636);
 client.setSecure(true);
 client.setKeystoreFile("/path/to/truststore.p12");
 client.connect(handler);  // Already secure, bind directly

Search Filters

Standard LDAP filter syntax (RFC 4515):

  • (uid=jdoe) - Equality
  • (cn=John*) - Substring
  • (age>=21) - Greater or equal
  • (&(objectClass=person)(uid=jdoe)) - AND
  • (|(uid=jdoe)(uid=jsmith)) - OR
  • (!(objectClass=computer)) - NOT

Modification Operations


 List<Modification> mods = new ArrayList<>();
 mods.add(Modification.replace("mail", "newemail@example.com"));
 mods.add(Modification.add("description", "Updated user"));
 mods.add(Modification.delete("oldAttr"));

 session.modify("cn=user,dc=example,dc=com", mods, new ModifyResultHandler() {
     public void handleModifyResult(LDAPResult result, LDAPSession session) {
         if (result.isSuccess()) {
             // Modification applied
         }
     }
 });

Result Codes

Common LDAP result codes (see LDAPResultCode):

  • SUCCESS (0) - Operation completed successfully
  • NO_SUCH_OBJECT (32) - Entry does not exist
  • INVALID_CREDENTIALS (49) - Wrong password
  • INSUFFICIENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS (50) - Not authorized
  • COMPARE_TRUE (6) - Compare matched
  • COMPARE_FALSE (5) - Compare did not match

Thread Safety

The LDAP client is designed for single-threaded use within a SelectorLoop. All callbacks are invoked on the selector thread.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AddResultHandler
    Handler for add operation results.
    BindResultHandler
    Handler for bind operation results.
    CompareResultHandler
    Handler for compare operation results.
    DeleteResultHandler
    Handler for delete operation results.
    ExtendedResultHandler
    Handler for extended operation results.
    LDAPConnected
    Operations available after LDAP connection is established.
    LDAPConnectionReady
    Handler interface for receiving the initial LDAP connection ready event.
    LDAPPostTLS
    Operations available after STARTTLS upgrade completes.
    LDAPSession
    Operations available in an authenticated LDAP session.
    ModifyDNResultHandler
    Handler for modify DN (rename/move) operation results.
    ModifyResultHandler
    Handler for modify operation results.
    SearchResultHandler
    Handler for search operation results.
    StartTLSResultHandler
    Handler for STARTTLS extended operation results.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LDAPClient
    LDAP client implementation that creates and manages LDAP client connections.
    LDAPClientConnection
    Event-driven, NIO-based LDAP client connection.
    LDAPConstants
    LDAP protocol constants.
    LDAPResult
    Represents an LDAP operation result.
    Modification
    Represents a modification to an LDAP entry attribute.
    SearchRequest
    Represents an LDAP search request.
    SearchResultEntry
    Represents a single entry from an LDAP search result.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    DerefAliases
    LDAP alias dereferencing policy as defined in RFC 4511.
    LDAPResultCode
    LDAP result codes as defined in RFC 4511.
    Modification.Operation
    Modification operation types.
    SearchScope
    LDAP search scope as defined in RFC 4511.
